hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Regime Shift on Failed Support Break
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC is in NEUTRAL regime and breaks below its 30-day volume-weighted average price (VWAP) by >2% on increasing volume, but fails to sustain the break (closes back above VWAP within 3 days), a transition to BEAR regime occurs within the next 5 trading days with >70% probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Failed breakdowns in neutral markets often signal exhaustion of selling pressure, but the failed attempt reveals underlying weakness. Market participants who sold on the break are trapped, creating overhead resistance. The subsequent inability to rally suggests accumulation of latent bearish sentiment, leading to regime transition.
entry_conditions: BTC daily close breaks below 30-day VWAP by >2%
Volume on break day > 20-day average volume
BTC closes back above 30-day VWAP within 3 days of initial break

exit_conditions.take_profit: Regime transitions to BEAR (confirmed by regime classifier)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC establishes new 10-day high above VWAP +1.5%
exit_conditions.time_exit: 5 trading days after entry without regime transition

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 30% of such signals result in transition to BULL regime or sustained NEUTRAL regime beyond 10 days.
